intro: Semecarpus tannaensis, commonly known as Tanna ironwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the island of Tanna in Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing kidney-shaped seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
